Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2012 04:23AM skyrocket wrote: Thank you for your replies. My family history is so far every female on my mums side has developed breast cancer, except (so far!) mum and I. So our history doesn't bode well for the future. To be very honest if I am going to get this I'm ready for the battle!I kind of expect to get it because of my family history and it's almost like I'd rather 'get it over and done with' rather than keep dreading it. I have PMDD (which is very severe PMS) and have been having treatment for that for 6 years now so I'm kind of looking forward to menopause as awful as it will undoubtable be because then I will be off the rollercoaster that my periods bring me each month. I am under the care of a Gynae for PMDD and it was him that decided the lump needed to be investigated urgently, showed a colleague who agreed and referred me to the breast clinic at hospital on an urgent appt. For months I've felt so tired and had the sugar cravings, I thought it was my thuroid but tests for that showed me being in the normal range. The lump is small and hard.  I just wondered if the sweet craving (and subsequent weight gain) could be a symptom of BC. I've always had a sweet tooth but it's gone into overdrive lately
